intro: Draba athoa, commonly known as the alpine whitlow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils at high elevations. Draba athoa has basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate, and it produces numerous small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
